title: The epistle of Gildas, the most ancient British author who flourished in the yeere of our Lord, 546. And who by his great erudition, sanctitie, and wisedome, acquired the name of sapiens. Faithfully translated out of the originall Latine.
author: Gildas, 516?-570?
publisher: Printed by T. Cotes, for William Cooke and are to be sold at his shop neere Furnivalls-Inne gate in Holborne,
notes: Translation by Thomas Abington of: Liber querulus de excidio Britanniae.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
The portrait is engraved and signed: Will: Marshall. sculp.
